# UIGraphicsPopContext()

**Function**

Removes the current graphics context from the top of the stack, restoring the previous context.

## Declaration

```swift
func UIGraphicsPopContext()
```

## Discussion

Use this function to balance calls to the [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIGraphicsPushContext(_:)] function.

This function may be called from any thread of your app.

## Graphics context primitives

- **UIGraphicsGetCurrentContext()**: Returns the current graphics context.
- **UIGraphicsPushContext(_:)**: Makes the specified graphics context the current context.
- **UIGraphicsBeginImageContextWithOptions(_:_:_:)**: Creates a bitmap-based graphics context with the specified options.
- **UIRectClip(_:)**: Modifies the current clipping path by intersecting it with the specified rectangle.
